word: I told the board plainly that not one of these men was competent for the situation; but we must have a president; and I presented before them the objectionable features in each case.  I told them that Elder Daniells was certainly standing in the best condition spiritually of any of them, and would be better fitted for the work than any other man in Australia.--Letter 40, 1892, pp. 13, 14. (To Elder O. A. Olsen, July 15, 1892.)
